span.b:
Significance level: α = 0.05 (5%);
Confidence level: CL = 1 - α = 0.95 (95%)

div.span:
Variance Equality F test
H0: s1 = s2; H1: s1 ≠ s2;

Welch Two Sample t-test
H0: μ1 = μ2

One-sided. H1: μ1 > μ2; H1: μ1 < μ2
t* = cdf, 1 - α

Two-sided. H1: μ1 ≠ μ2
t* = cdf, 1 - α / 2

One-sided. H1: μ > μ0; H1: μ < μ0
t* = cdf, 1 - α

Two-sided. H1: μ ≠ μ0
t* = cdf, 1 - α / 2

Reject H0! H1 is the true hypothesis.
Type I error = p-value

Fail to reject H0Not enough evidence to reject H0
Type II error is unknown
One sample with: n, μ̂, s

Two samples with:
S1: n1, μ̂1 and s1 S2: n1, μ̂2, s2
